smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function contentValues appears to be too complex.
The function saveEvents appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: File 'CalendarExtensions.kt' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: it.second cannot be safely cast to Boolean.
it.second cannot be safely cast to Float.
it.second cannot be safely cast to Int.
it.second cannot be safely cast to Long.
it.second cannot be safely cast to String.
getSystemService(NOTIFICATION_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to NotificationManager.
getSystemService(Context.JOB_SCHEDULER_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to JobScheduler.

smells.name: UnsafeCallOnNullableType
smells.description: It will throw a NullPointerException at runtime if your nullable value is null.

instances.message: Calling !! on a nullable type will throw a NullPointerException at runtime in case the value is null. It should be avoided.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.
